intro: Ponthieva oligoneura, commonly known as the slender-stemmed ponthieva, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in a spadix. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshy areas near water bodies. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists studying wetland ecosystems.
